conclusion: To determine if displacements of cars A and B are the same, analyze their velocity-time graphs.
Displacement is given by the area under the velocity-time graph.
Car A's velocity-time graph is represented by curve A.
Car B's velocity-time graph is represented by curve B.
Displacement of each car is equal to the area under its respective velocity-time curve from t=0 to t=t1.
For Car A, the area under the curve is bounded by curve A, the time axis, and vertical lines at t=0 and t=t1.
For Car B, the area under the curve is bounded by curve B, the time axis, and vertical lines at t=0 and t=t1.
The area under curve A is larger than the area under curve B within the time interval t=0 to t=t1.
Since the area under the velocity-time graph represents displacement, Car A has a greater displacement than Car B.
The displacements of cars A and B are not the same; Car A has a greater displacement.
